entry.title: Armenia welcomes Google delegation on first-of-its-kind visit: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia welcomes Google delegation on first-of-its-kind visit: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç A delegation from Google visited Armenia for first-of-their-kind talks with the country‚Äôs high-tech industry minister to review potential business opportunities. üìç Prosecutors have still not charged anyone with a crime in connection with the collapse of Armenia‚Äôs state investment fund earlier this year, the Prosecutor General‚Äôs Office told the Fact Investigation Platform news site. An investigation remains ongoing. üìç Armenia is close to meeting the requirements that would allow it to leave the European Union‚Äôs aviation blacklist, the country‚Äôs infrastructure minister announced.
Credits: Ruptly

media:group.media:title: Gurumiran: Live for Independence vol.II
media:group.media:description:
’Ä’°’µ’°’Ω’ø’°’∂’´ ’°’∂’Ø’°’≠’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂ 33-’°’¥’µ’°’Ø’´ ’°’º’©’´’æ Gurumiran ’≠’∏÷Ç’¥’¢’® ’∞’µ’∏÷Ç÷Ä’®’∂’Ø’°’¨’æ’•÷Å ’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’©’´ ’∫’°’ø’∑’£’°’¥’¢’∏÷Ç’¥÷â
Gurumiran ’≠’∏÷Ç’¥’¢’® ’Ω’ø’•’≤’Æ’•’¨ ’ß ’¨’´’¢’°’∂’°’∂’°’∞’°’µ ’Ñ’´÷Ä’°’∂ ‘≥’∏÷Ç÷Ä’∏÷Ç’∂’µ’°’∂’®÷â ’Ñ’´÷Ä’°’∂’® ‘≤’•’µ÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’´÷Å ’ß, 2020-’´’∂ ’î’∏’æ’´’§’´, ’°’∫’° ‘≤’•’µ÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ø’•’≤’´ ’∏÷Ç’∂’•÷Å’°’Æ ’∫’°’µ’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’´÷Å ’∞’•’ø’∏ ’ø’•’≤’°÷É’∏’≠’æ’•’¨ ÷á ’∞’°’Ω’ø’°’ø’æ’•’¨ ’ß ’Ä’°’µ’°’Ω’ø’°’∂’∏÷Ç’¥÷â ’Ñ’´÷Ä’°’∂’´ ’Ω’ø’•’≤’Æ’°’£’∏÷Ä’Æ’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∂’•÷Ä’® ’∏’£’•’∑’∂’π’æ’°’Æ ’•’∂ ’¥’∑’°’Ø’∏÷Ç’©’°’µ’´’∂ ’¢’°’¶’¥’°’¶’°’∂ ’°’¶’§’•÷Å’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´÷Å÷â Gurumiran ’≠’¥’¢’´ ’°’º’°’ª’´’∂ ’°’¨’¢’∏’¥’® ’¨’∏÷Ç’µ’Ω ’ß ’ø’•’Ω’•’¨ 2015-’´’∂÷â ’Ü÷Ä’°’∂÷Ñ ’Ω’ø’•’≤’Æ’°’£’∏÷Ä’Æ’∏÷Ç’¥ ’•’∂ ’∞’°’µ’•÷Ä’•’∂, ’°’∂’£’¨’•÷Ä’•’∂, ’°÷Ä’°’¢’•÷Ä’•’∂ ÷á ÷Ü÷Ä’°’∂’Ω’•÷Ä’•’∂÷â ‘Ω’¥’¢’´ Notes from Underground ’°’¨’¢’∏’¥’® ’Ø’©’∏’≤’°÷Ä’Ø’æ’´ 2025-’´’∂÷â
CivilNet hosted the Gurumiran band for an exclusive performance to mark Armenia‚Äôs independence day on September 21.
Gurumiran was created by Lebanese Armenian artist and musician Miran Gurunian, who relocated to Yerevan from Beirut after the COVID-19 pandemic and port explosion in 2020. Miran says his creations are inspired by his diverse cultural influences, and since his band‚Äôs debut in 2015, Gurumiran has made music in Armenian, English, Arabic, and French. The band's newest album, ‚ÄúNotes from Underground,‚Äù will be released next year.

entry.title: Armenia marks one year since fall of Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Armenia marks one year since fall of Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
üìç In a statement to mark one year since Azerbaijan‚Äôs takeover of Nagorno-Karabakh, Armenia‚Äôs Foreign Ministry decried what it termed Azerbaijan‚Äôs ethnic cleansing of the region‚Äôs Armenians and reiterated Armenia‚Äôs readiness to sign a normalization deal. üìç Lawyers representing two former Nagorno-Karabakh officials asked the International Criminal Court to investigate Azerbaijan‚Äôs leaders for crimes against humanity. For more information: https://shorturl.at/Q4Wdr üìç Insights with Eric Hacopian: https://youtu.be/bCcxorjD5aM

entry.title: Can Artsakh Armenians reclaim their homeland?

media:group.media:title: Can Artsakh Armenians reclaim their homeland?
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, we commemorate the one-year anniversary of the September 19 aggression that led to the ethnic cleansing of Artsakh Armenians, an event some legal experts consider the start of a genocide. The discussion delves deep into the critical issue of the right of return for Artsakh Armenians to their ancestral lands, exploring its historical context, legal ramifications, and the complex political landscape surrounding this fundamental human right.
